23-008EC.summary: Recommendation to approve the minutes of the Ethics Commission Regular Meeting on Wednesday, January 11, 2023. Commissioner Wise spoke.Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.A dialogue ensued between Commissioner Wise and Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney.Chair Morales spoke.Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.Page 1 of 8411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 3:00 PMWEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 8, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHETHICS COMMISSION MINUTESCommissioner Wise spoke; and made a motion.Jonathan Nagayama, City Clerk Analyst, spoke.Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.A dialogue ensued between Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney and Jonathan Nagayama, City Clerk Analyst.Chair Morales spoke.Jonathan Nagayama, City Clerk Analyst, spoke.Vice Chair Pollack spoke.Commissioner Fiedler spoke.Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.Commissioner Shotwell spoke.Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.Commissioner Wise spoke.Chair Morales spoke.Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.A motion was made by Commissioner Wise, seconded by Commissioner Shotwell, to approve motion to reflect the point when motions are made during the discussion in the minutes.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 6 - Raúl Añorve, Lani De Benedictis, Luke Fiedler, J. P. Shotwell, Susan Wise and Barbara PollackNo: 1 - Margo MoralesPage 2 of 8411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 3:00 PMWEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 8, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHETHICS COMMISSION MINUTESA motion was made by Commissioner Wise, seconded by Commissioner De Benedictis, to approve recommendation, as amended, to modify the minutes to reflect the point when the motions were made.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 6 - Raúl Añorve, Lani De Benedictis, J. P. Shotwell, Susan Wise, Barbara Pollack and Margo MoralesAbstain: 1 - Luke Fiedler2.

23-009EC.summary: Recommendation to receive and file a presentation on the December 20, 2022 memorandum titled “Senate Bill 1439 - Campaign Contributions to City Elected and Appointed Officers”; and request a report back from City staff on plans to implement a process regarding the same. Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney, spoke; and provided a PowerPoint presentation.Commissioner Wise spoke.Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.A dialogue ensued between Commissioner Wise and Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney.Commissioner Shotwell spoke.Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.A dialogue ensued between Commissioner Shotwell and Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney.Commissioner De Benedictis spoke.A motion was made by Commissioner De Benedictis, seconded by Commissioner Añorve, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 7 - Raúl Añorve, Lani De Benedictis, Luke Fiedler, J. P. Shotwell, Susan Wise, Barbara Pollack and Margo MoralesPage 3 of 8411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 3:00 PMWEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 8, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHETHICS COMMISSION MINUTES3.

22-043EC.summary: Recommendation to discuss amendments proposed to the Lobbyists Ordinance (Long Beach Municipal Code Chapter 2.08) by the Ad Hoc Committee on the Lobbyist Ordinance; and if necessary, provide a recommendation to the City Council regarding the same and dissolve the Lobbyist Ordinance Ad Hoc Committee.Vice Chair Pollack spoke; and presented a report.Commissioner Wise spoke.Commissioner De Benedictis spoke.Commissioner Añorve spoke.Vice Chair Pollack spoke.A dialogue ensued between Vice Chair Pollack and Commissioner Añorve.Chair Morales spoke.Commissioner Añorve spoke.A dialogue ensued between Chair Morales and Commissioner Añorve.Commissioner Fiedler spoke.Chair Morales spoke.Commissioner Wise spoke.Commissioner Shotwell spoke.Vice Chair Pollack spoke.A dialogue ensued between Vice Chair Pollack and Commissioner Shotwell.Commissioner Añorve spoke.Chair Morales spoke.Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.Page 4 of 8411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 3:00 PMWEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 8, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHETHICS COMMISSION MINUTESA dialogue ensued among Chair Morales, Commissioner Añorve, and Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney.Julian Cernuda, Assistant to the City Manager, spoke.Commissioner Wise spoke.Chair Morales spoke.Commissioner Shotwell spoke.A dialogue ensued between Chair Morales and Commissioner Shotwell.Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.Chair Morales spoke; and made a motion.A motion was made by Chair Morales, seconded by Commissioner De Benedictis, to approve recommendation, as amended, that the item be continued to the Ethics Commission meeting of Wednesday, March 8, 2023; request the four non-Ad Hoc members review the document and submit comments to staff by the end of February; and request staff to seek input from stakeholders, including, but not limited to lobbyists, advocate groups, and the community via a press release and/or any other options available with the goal to get the feedback to the Commission by the March meeting.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 7 - Raúl Añorve, Lani De Benedictis, Luke Fiedler, J. P. Shotwell, Susan Wise, Barbara Pollack and Margo Morales4.

22-090EC.summary: Recommendation to receive and file a report on an Overview of the Powers and Authorities of Local California Ethics Commissions. Julian Cernuda, Assistant to the City Manager, spoke; and presented the staff report.Commissioner Wise spoke.Page 5 of 8411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 3:00 PMWEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 8, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHETHICS COMMISSION MINUTESTaylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.A dialogue ensued between Commissioner Wise and Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney.A motion was made by Commissioner Wise, seconded by Commissioner De Benedictis, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 6 - Lani De Benedictis, Luke Fiedler, J. P. Shotwell, Susan Wise, Barbara Pollack and Margo MoralesAbsent: 1 - Raúl Añorve5.

23-011EC.summary: Recommendation to receive and file a report from the Ad Hoc Committees; and, if necessary, take appropriate action to dissolve or create Ad Hoc Committees.Commissioner Shotwell spoke; and presented a report.A motion was made by Commissioner De Benedictis, seconded by Commissioner Shotwell, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 6 - Lani De Benedictis, Luke Fiedler, J. P. Shotwell, Susan Wise, Barbara Pollack and Margo MoralesAbsent: 1 - Raúl Añorve6.

23-010EC.summary: Recommendation to receive and file a monthly update from the Ethics Officer.Heather Van Wijk, Ethics Officer, spoke; and presented the staff report.Chair Morales spoke.A motion was made by Commissioner De Benedictis, seconded by Commissioner Wise, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 6 - Lani De Benedictis, Luke Fiedler, J. P. Shotwell, Susan Wise, Barbara Pollack and Margo MoralesAbsent: 1 - Raúl AñorvePage 6 of 8411 W.
